workflow.name: Generate UGC ads from Google Sheets with Fal.ai models (nano-banana, WAN2.2, Veo3)
workflow.description:
âš ï¸ **Note:** All sensitive credentials should be set via **n8n Credentials** or environment variables. Do **not** hardcode API keys in nodes.

---

## Whoâ€™s it for
Marketers, creators, and automation builders who want to generate **UGC-style ad images and short videos** automatically from a Google Sheet. Ideal for eâ€‘commerce SKUs, agencies, or teams that need many variations quickly.

---

## What it does (Overview)
This template turns a spreadsheet row into **ad images** and optionally **5â€“8s videos**.

- **Zone 0 â€” Image-only pipeline (Gemini/OpenRouter)**: Creates an ad image from a product link and prompt, uploads it to Drive, and updates the sheet (no video step).
- **Zone 1 â€” Create image (Fal nanoâ€‘banana) + prepare for video**: Generates an image via Fal.ai, polls status, fetches URL, then analyzes the image with LLM to prepare scene prompts.
- **Zone 2 â€” Generate video (WAN2.2 & Veo3)**: Uses the generated image + structured scene prompts to create short clips, uploads them to Drive, and writes the video URL back to the sheet.

---

## Requirements
- **Fal.ai API key** (env: `FAL_KEY`)
- **Google Sheets / Google Drive** OAuth2 credentials
- **OpenAI / Gemini (via OpenRouter)** for image analysis or alternative image generation
- A Google Sheet with columns, e.g.: `product | presenter | prompt | img_url | video_url`
- Google Drive files set to **Anyone with link â†’ Viewer** so APIs can fetch them

---

## How to set up
1. **Credentials**: Add Google Sheets + Google Drive (OAuth2), Fal.ai (Header Auth with `Authorization: Key {{$env.FAL_KEY}}`), and OpenAI/OpenRouter.
2. **Google Sheet**: Create the columns above. Paste product image Drive links (the workflow converts them to direct links automatically).
3. **Import the workflow**: Use the provided JSON. Confirm node credentials resolve.
4. **Run**: Start with Zone 0 to verify image-only flow, then test Zone 1 + Zone 2 for full imageâ†’video.

---

## Zone 0 â€” Create Ad Image (Image-only)
This path is for creating **just an image** and stopping. It reads the **Gemini** tab in the Sheet, generates an image via OpenRouter/Gemini, converts base64 to a file, uploads to Drive, and writes back `img_url`.

**Key nodes**
- **Get Data1 (Google Sheets)** â†’ reads `Gemini` tab
- **setImgeURL (Set)** â†’ converts Drive URLs to direct (`uc?export=view&id=...`)
- **CreateImagebyOpernRouter (Gemini)** â†’ calls `google/gemini-2.5-flash-image-preview:free`
- **wait20sec (Wait)** â†’ small delay
- **setBase64data (Code)** â†’ splits data URI into `{ data, mimeType, fileName }`
- **Convert to File** â†’ creates binary
- **uploadImagetoGdrive (Google Drive)** â†’ uploads image
- **updateImageURL (Google Sheets)** â†’ writes back `img_url`

---

## Zone 1 â€” Create Image (Fal nanoâ€‘banana) + Prepare for Video
Reads product rows, normalizes Drive links, generates image with **Fal nanoâ€‘banana**, polls until complete, fetches the output image URL, then runs an **image analysis** (OpenAI Vision) to prepare structured text for the video step.

**Key nodes**
- **Get Data (Google Sheets)** â†’ reads `nanoBanana` tab
- **Edit Fields (Set)** â†’ converts Drive links to direct (`uc?export=view&id=...`)
- **Call Fal.ai API (nanoBanana)** â†’ `POST https://queue.fal.run/fal-ai/nano-banana/edit`
- **Get image status / If / Wait / Get the image** â†’ job polling until complete
- **Analyze image (OpenAI Vision)** â†’ returns structured description (brand text, colors, type, short description)

---

## Zone 2 â€” Generate Video (WAN2.2 & Veo3)
Creates a 5â€“8s UGC clip using the generated image + structured scene prompt.

**Key nodes**
- **Describe Each Scene for Video (AI Agent)** â†’ expands analysis + user intent into detailed scene sections (Characters, Scene Background, Camera Movement, Movement in Scene, Sound Design)
- **Structured Output Parser2 (Schema)** â†’ enforces consistent JSON structure
- **Veo3 (HTTP)** â†’ `POST /fal-ai/veo3/image-to-video` with prompt + `image_url`
- **Call Fal.ai API (WAN2.2) [Optional]** â†’ `POST /fal-ai/wan/v2.2-a14b/image-to-video`
- **Wait for the video / Get the video status / Video status / Get the video** â†’ polling loop
- **HTTP Request (Download File)** â†’ downloads MP4
- **uploadImagetoGdrive1 (Google Drive)** â†’ uploads video
- **updateVideoURL (Google Sheets)** â†’ writes back `video_url`

---

## Node settings (highâ€‘level)
- **Drive Link Parser (Set)**
  ```js
  {{ (() => {
    const u = $json.product || '';
    const q = u.match(/[?&]id=([-\w]{25,})/);
    const d = u.match(/\/d\/([-\w]{25,})/);
    const any = u.match(/[-\w]{25,}/);
    const id = q?.[1] || d?.[1] || (any ? any[0] : '');
    return id ? 'https://drive.google.com/uc?export=view&id=' + id : '';
  })() }}
---

## How to customize the workflow

* Adjust **AI prompts** to change ad style (funny, luxury, cozy, techy).
* Change **video aspect ratio** for TikTok/IG/Shorts (`9:16`, `1:1`, `16:9`).
* Extend Sheet schema for campaign labels, audiences, hashtags.
* Add distribution (Slack/LINE/Telegram) after Drive upload.

---

## Troubleshooting

* **JSON parameter needs to be valid JSON** â†’ Ensure expressions return objects, not strings.
* **403 on images** â†’ Make Drive files public (Viewer) and convert links.
* **Video never completes** â†’ Check `status_url`, retry with `*-fast` models or offâ€‘peak times.

---

## Template metadata

* **Uses:** Google Sheets, Google Drive, HTTP Request, Wait/If/Switch, Code, Convert to File, OpenAI/Gemini (optional), Fal.ai models (nanoâ€‘banana, WAN2.2, Veo3)
* **Source workflow JSON:** Gemini\_NanoBanana\_Template.json (node names and connections match)

## Product Image
![Alt text](https://drive.google.com/thumbnail?id=1ROt8xvXvpcodXzgNBOlrNQVuiwV1qeRT&sz=w600)
## Product Image - nano Banana
![Alt text](https://drive.google.com/thumbnail?id=13ZwkKDBfvDw2TXSGFOo7xZL5jd6JTfHK&sz=w600)

## Product Video - Veo3
![Alt text](https://drive.google.com/thumbnail?id=1RSLfg3e2ZqJsKv5YLmmGOX7zHHUYEJKK&sz=w600)

## Product Video - Wan2.2
![Alt text](https://drive.google.com/thumbnail?id=1cdV0Q3j15X5zMvEPhwAQM1uHcGiZIJl1&sz=w600)

parameters.content:
### ðŸŸ¨ Zone 1: Create Image

1. **When clicking 'Execute workflow**
2. **Get ImageURL and Prompt(Google Sheets)**
3. **Create Image by Fal.ai (nano banana)**
4. **Analys image for preparing video**

### ðŸŸ« Zone 2:Generate Video

1. **Prepare Prompt for Video**
2. **Call Fal.ai API (Seedance/Wan2.2)**
3. **Loop Over Items**
4. **Wait for the video / Get the video status / Video status**
5. **Upload Video to Google Drive**
5. **Upload Video URL**

## Product Video - Veo3
![Alt text](https://drive.google.com/thumbnail?id=1RSLfg3e2ZqJsKv5YLmmGOX7zHHUYEJKK&sz=w600)

## Product Video - Wan2.2
![Alt text](https://drive.google.com/thumbnail?id=1cdV0Q3j15X5zMvEPhwAQM1uHcGiZIJl1&sz=w600)

### ðŸŸ¨ Zone 1: Create Image by nano Bananna

1. **When clicking 'Execute workflow**
2. **Get ImageURL and Prompt(Google Sheets)**
3. **Create Image by OpernRouter (gemini-2.5-flash-image-preview:free)**
4. **Upload to Google drive /output**
5. **Update URL**

parameters.text:
Analyze the image: is it a product, a character, or both?

If product â†’ return JSON:
  brand_name: (brand if visible/inferable)
  color_scheme:
    - hex: (HEX of main colors)
      name: (color name)
  font_style: (if visible)
  visible_text: |
    (all legible text exactly)
  product_type: (type of product)
  visual_description: (1â€“2 sentences about subject)

If character â†’ return JSON:
  character_name: (if known/inferable)
  color_scheme:
    - hex: (HEX of main colors on outfit/character)
      name: (color name)
  outfit_style: (clothes/accessories)
  visual_description: (1â€“2 sentences about subject)

Output JSON only.

parameters.text:
=You are a Video Scene Prompt Generator for Veo3. 
Your job is to take the scene input below and expand it into a detailed 5-second video description, following these rules:

1. Use the scene input as the core reference. Do not remove or alter product names, logos, or visible text from the reference image.
2. Expand the description into a natural, realistic **UGC-style video scene**. The output must feel authentic, casual, and human-made (like a phone video).
3. Break down the scene into these sections:
   - Characters: List all characters in the scene with age, attire, appearance, posture, emotion, and what they are doing.
   - Scene Background: Describe the environment in detail (location, lighting, colors, props, atmosphere, time of day).
   - Camera Movement: Describe how the camera moves (handheld, selfie, panning, zooming, tilt, etc.), as if filmed on a smartphone.
   - Movement in Scene: Show how the character(s) and product interact or move naturally in the 5-second clip.
   - Sound Design: Suggest casual voice/dialogue (under 150 characters, natural & authentic tone), plus ambient sounds or background noise that fit the scene.

4. The **dialogue** should sound natural, short, and conversational (like talking to a friend), not scripted or commercial. 
5. Keep everything **photorealistic** and authentic, not overly polished or cinematic. Emphasize realism and relatability.

Scene Input (from previous step):
{{ $json.content }}

Return your answer in **plain text** exactly in the following structure (no JSON, no extra commentary):

Characters:
- ...
- ...

Scene Background: ...
Camera Movement: ...
Movement in Scene: ...
Sound Design: ...

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
